qas.question: Was the famous school in Alexandria religious only?
Did only Christians attend the school?
Was Alexandria welcoming to other cultures?
What was the name of the city where Athanasius went to catechetical school?
What was Alexandria not known for?
What epitomized the ethnically uniform world?

context: <b5_0><b6_0><b9_0>Alexandria<b9_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> was <b4_0>the most <a0_0><b8_0>important trade center<b8_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> in the whole empire during Athanasius's boyhood. Intellectually, morally, and politically—it epitomized the <a3_0>ethnically diverse<a3_0/> Graeco-Roman world, even more than <b7_0>Rome<b7_0/> or Constantinople, Antioch or Marseilles. Its famous catechetical school, while sacrificing none of its famous passion for orthodoxy since the days of Pantaenus, Clement of Alexandria, Origen of Alexandria, Dionysius and Theognostus, had begun to take on an almost <a1_0>secular character<a1_0/> in the comprehensiveness of its interests, and had counted <a2_0>influential pagans<a2_0/> among its serious auditors.
